definition: to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
brocade sack of miracle plans (idiom); bag of tricks/fiendishly cunning masterplan (written out by strategic genius of fiction, and given to the local commander in a brocade bag)

sentences.english: To get myself to actually do, my favorite trick is the 50 minutes rule.
sentences.chinese: 努力让自己上路，我的锦囊妙计是50分钟法则。

sentences.english: Tom had an ace up his sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆备有锦囊妙计胸有成竹。

sentences.english: E Mao as a fan, a Miaoji mind.
sentences.chinese: 鹅毛扇这么一扇，一个妙计涌上心头。

sentences.english: My friend Collins, therefore, undertook to manage a little for me.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我的朋友高令斯就替我想了一个小小的妙计。

sentences.english: I have a coup, I wonder if we resist you hurt?
sentences.chinese: 我有一条妙计，不知你忍得住痛吗？

sentences.english: But even smarter tactics might not be enough to regain lost ground.
sentences.chinese: 不过，也许即使是奇策妙计也不足以挽回损失。

sentences.english: And a group of researchers in Britain think they have found one.
sentences.chinese: 英国的一组研究人员认为他们自有锦囊妙计。

sentences.english: She is always experimenting, always attempting the coup d’eclat.
sentences.chinese: 她总是乐于尝试，总是试图用妙计来取得成功。

sentences.english: Unless you've got an ace up your sleeve, we are dished.
sentences.chinese: 除非你有锦囊妙计，否则，我们是输定了。

sentences.english: At last the old Fox thought up a way to catch the little Red Hen.
sentences.chinese: 终于，老狐狸想出了一条抓小红母鸡的妙计。

sentences.english: Unless you've had ace up your sleeve, we are dished.
sentences.chinese: 除非你有锦囊妙计，否则我们是输定了。

sentences.english: JiTie mouth after listen to, and mind.
sentences.chinese: 齐铁嘴听后，便心生妙计。

sentences.english: It was at this moment that Mr. Budd had his Great Idea.
sentences.chinese: 就是在这一刻，巴德先生想出了他的妙计。

sentences.english: The Evening Messenger printed the full story of his Great Idea.
sentences.chinese: 《晚间信使报》刊登了他妙计的全部细节。

sentences.english: Oh, really? And what would that ace be exactly?
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我还真不信。那你的妙计是什么啊？

sentences.english: He pastured with the flock, beguiling the shepherd by his artifice.
sentences.chinese: 他和羊群混在一起吃草，用这个妙计骗过了牧羊人。

definition: brocade sack of miracle plans (idiom); bag of tricks/fiendishly cunning masterplan (written out by strategic genius of fiction, and given to the local commander in a brocade bag)
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
divine strategy and wonderful planning (idiom)/clever scheme/supremely clever in his schemes
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
